授業方法:
This course will be conducted face-to-face.
Depending on the evolving situation, course format may include the following:
- Individual, pair, and group discussion based on topics that relate to content
- Sharing of information, including weekly homework assignments, on Google Classroom- Presentation and homework assignments
- All components conducted in English
- As a level 1 course, all English tasks expected to be completed at an intermediate level

第1回:
**The schedule below is an example of what the course will look like. Specific contents will not be decided upon until after a needs analysis is done (during first class) to determine the interests, backgrounds, and needs of enrolled students**

Week 1: Class overview, introductions, ice breakers
第2回: Week 2: Introduction to culture: what is Japanese culture? Discuss first 220-word journal.
第3回: Week 3: What influences Japanese character? Why are Japanese people the way they are? Discuss second 220-word journal.
第4回: Week 4: What is Canadian culture? What makes Canadians the way they are? Discuss third 220-word journal.
第5回: Week 5: What does it mean to be “hafu” or mixed race? What are their experiences? Discuss fourth 220-word journal.
第6回: Week 6: How does media (e.g. TV, movies) affect our idea of culture and people? Discuss fifth 220-word journal.
第7回: Week 7: How can we learn about culture? Identifying internet sources. Discuss sixth 220-word journal
第8回: Week 8: Is English different around the world? How can we communicate when we don’t know the local language? Discuss seventh 220-word journal.
第9回: Week 9: How can we adapt to cultural differences abroad? What is most important for Japanese people? Discuss ninth 220-word journal.
第10回: Week 10: Can there be major cultural differences within a country? Kansai vs. Kanto, Eastern vs. Western Canada. Discuss ninth 220-word journal.
第11回: Week 11: Culture and the university experience: what is important for successful study abroad? Discuss final 220-word journal.
トピック.授業外学習2: Each class will involve information and topics that will need to be applied to a final presentation. It is the students’ responsibility to make notes during each class so they can successfully accomplish this. Each class, students will need to submit a journal of at least 220 words based on discussion questions related to the topic. You should have a stable wifi or internet connection at home to complete all out-of-class assignments. Students will be expected to perform tasks in English at an intermediate level.
